com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Interface Smartable<AggregateClass>

  • Type Parameters:
    AggregateClass - the aggregate class accessible though the Smarted.setAggregate(Object) and Smarted.getAggregate() methods
    All Superinterfaces:
    AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic, LifeCycle, Smarted<AggregateClass>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSmartListActivity, AbstractWrappedSmartListActivity, Droid4mizer, ForBusinessObjectActivity, SmartActionBarActivity, SmartActivity, SmartDialogFragment, SmartDialogFragment, SmartFragment, SmartFragment, SmartFragmentActivity, SmartGroupActivity, SmartListActivity, SmartListViewFragment, SmartListViewFragment, SmartMapActivity, SmartPreferenceActivity, SmartPreferenceFragment, SmartSplashScreenActivity, SmartTabActivity, WrappedSmartListActivity

    public interface Smartable<AggregateClass>
extends Smarted<AggregateClass>, LifeCycle, AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
    All activities and fragments entities of the framework must at least implement this composite interface.

    Any entity implementing this interface is considered as droid4me-ready (or droid4me-compliant) and benefit from all the framework features.

    If the implementing entity also implements the AppPublics.BroadcastListener, or the AppPublics.BroadcastListenerProvider or the AppPublics.BroadcastListenersProvider interface, the framework will register one or several broadcast receivers, as explained in the AppPublics.BroadcastListener.

    When it is required to have an existing Activity or Fragment implement this interface, you may use the Droid4mizer on that purpose.

    Since:
    2011.03.04
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier
    See Also:
    SmartableActivity, Droid4mizer

    • Field Detail

        static final Logger log

    • Method Detail

      • shouldKeepOn

        boolean shouldKeepOn()
        Indicates whether nothing went wrong during the implementing entity, or if a redirection is being processed.

        Thanks to the redirection controller, it is possible to re-route any Smartable Activity when it starts, if some other Activity needs to be executed beforehand.

        Returns:
        true if and only if the implementing Activity/@{link android.app.Fragment} entity should resume its execution
